title: Bug 120922: 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description: Bug 120922: 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement. Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved.' (including the quotes). And then the user needs to figure out how to save or discard their changes. The prompt asks the user, 'Do you want to save the changes?'. The options provided are: 'Yes', 'No', and 'Cancel'. 'Yes' would save the changes, 'No' would discard the changes, and 'Cancel' would do nothing and remain on the Source page. In addition, the dialog is titled 'Error' (including the quotes).
OB: When editing the XML in the 'Source' view of the Layout Editor and then trying to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed indicating that the changes need to be saved.
EB: A better and more typical approach would be for the dialog to use a better title (without the quotes) and provide clearer instructions on how to save or discard the changes.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the XML Report Designer editor.
2. Edit the XML in the 'Source' view of the Layout Editor.
3. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view.
4. Observe the error message 'Source page is dirty.' indicating that the changes need to be saved.
